description: From Middle English swete hert, swete heorte (phrase of endearment); equivalent to sweet +â€Ž heart.

entries.meaning: A person who is always very kind.
examples: She is such a sweetheart: she never complains about me being late.

entries.meaning: A person very much liked or loved by someone, especially when both partners are young.
examples: John married his high-school sweetheart in 1981.

entries.meaning: (US) A female member of a college or university fraternity.
